perturbation.original_text: This Promotion Agreement (the "Agreement") is dated as of January 26, 1998 between CNET, Inc. ("CNET") and Cyberian Outpost, Inc. (the "Company"). Pursuant to this Agreement, CNET will provide various links and other online and television promotions (collectively, the "Promotions") to the Company to assist the Company in promoting its products and services and facilitating the sale of products to potential buyers through its Internet site. CNET will be compensated by the Company for providing the Promotions. Accordingly, the parties hereby agree as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: This Promotion Agreement (the "Agreement") is dated as of January 26, 1998 between CNET, Inc. ("CNET") and Cyberian Outpost, Inc. (the "Company"). Pursuant to this Agreement, CNET will provide various links and other online and television promotions (collectively, the "Campaigns") to the Company to assist the Company in promoting its products and services and facilitating the sale of products to potential buyers through its Internet site. CNET will be compensated by the Company for providing the Campaigns. Accordingly, the parties hereby agree as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Promotions' is changed to 'Campaigns.' Later in the document, 'Promotions' are defined differently, creating confusion as to what CNET is actually providing.

perturbation.original_text: The Company will be responsible for ensuring that each link embedded within an Online Promotion takes the User to the appropriate area within the Company Site, and that the Company Site functions with reasonable reliability and in a commercially reasonable manner throughout the Term. In particular, the Company agrees that the Company Site will comply with the performance standards set forth in Exhibit B throughout the Term. Any failure by the Company to comply with this paragraph will be deemed to be a material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will be responsible for ensuring that each link embedded within an Online Ad takes the User to the appropriate area within the Company Site, and that the Company Site functions with reasonable reliability and in a commercially reasonable manner throughout the Term. In particular, the Company agrees that the Company Site will comply with the performance standards set forth in Exhibit B throughout the Term. Any failure by the Company to comply with this paragraph will be deemed to be a material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Online Promotion' with 'Online Ad' introduces ambiguity. It is unclear whether an "Online Ad" is different from an "Online Promotion", potentially changing the scope of the Company's responsibility and constituting a material breach.

perturbation.original_text: For each month during the Term, the Company will pay CNET a minimum of [XXXX] in cash, plus [XXX] of CNET Sales. Payments under this paragraph will be based on the reports prepared by the Company under Section 3.2 (although CNET may challenge such reports as contemplated by Section 9.5) and will be due within 30 days after the end of each month of the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: For each month during the Term, the Company will pay CNET a minimum of [XXXX] in cash, plus [XXX] of CNET Revenue. Payments under this paragraph will be based on the reports prepared by the Company under Section 3.2 (although CNET may challenge such reports as contemplated by Section 9.5) and will be due within 30 days after the end of each month of the Term.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "CNET Sales" to "CNET Revenue" introduces ambiguity, as the term CNET Sales has been defined explicitly in Section 3.2. The new term is similar, but may be seen as distinct from it. This change may lead to disputes over the payment amount.
